title.narrative: Humanitarian Response and Resilience Building for Drought-Affected Communities in Afar Region

description.narrative: Drought affected people in need in North Afar, Ethiopia.

Four years of successive drought in Ethiopia and the failure of the recent rainy season has seriously affected the country, especially in the lowland areas. In the Afar Region the hotspot woredas of Elidar and Kori are facing a critical situation. In these woredas, drinking water is the top priority and current emergency water trucking by Cordaid partner APDA provides around 1.6 liters per day until May 3rd 2018 which is way below the Sphere standard of survival water intake of 2.5 to 3 liters per day. In Elidar, the community has not received nutrition surveillance and treatment of malnutrition as reported by the Bureau of Health monthly taskforce. Until December 31st, APDA was supporting this population but their situation has deteriorated to a SAM of 6.7% and a MAM of 17.9% (it should be noted that the survey covered only 21% of the target since it was undertaken without logistic support). The underlying factors include an actual lack of food in the households since government emergency food was not delivered in the woredas for the past 3 months and livestock are unable to produce milk due to their poor conditions due to lack of water and pasture. If assistance is not provided, many children under five and pregnant & lactating mothers face the risk of a critical nutrition emergency.

Objective: Supporting basic needs and resilience of drought affected people in need in North Afar by combining First and second line humanitarian response in wash, nutrition, livelihoods and resilient recovery.
